channel.title: General Midi collaborative library
channel.description:
I’ve decided to start a topic / challenge for the creation of a collaborative “General Midi” library.
The aim is to have a bunch of patches, easy to use, and useful to learn understand basic axoloti patching. It would be great to cover all the main sounds included in the GM 1 sound set, but it’s only names, so we’re very free to do whatever it inspires us. It’s not very important to be realistic, everybody has probably very different visions of what a synthesized acoustic patch may sound like, many sounds are synth oriented too. All kind of synthesis are welcome, and we can propose multiple patches for the same patch number (we can never have enough warm pads). If you use wavetables or samples, you need to host them somewhere, and link here, with your patch. You can share your patch by using your contrib patch folder or host it directly on this thread (or both).
Lets try and keep the patches simple to use (midi note, velocity, note on, mod wheel #1, pitch bend, aftertouch... if needed). They should respect a certain logic concerning polyphony (a piano’ish sound should be playable with at least 8 voices, but a bass a lot less)
I will update this post with links to the thread post that includes your patch.
**Piano** 1 Acoustic Grand Piano 2 Bright Acoustic Piano 3 Electric Grand Piano [mtyas - electric grand piano](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/2?u=mtyas) 4 Honky-tonk Piano [mtyas - Honky piano](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/7?u=mtyas) 5 Electric Piano 1 [mtyas - Electric piano 1](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/8?u=mtyas) 6 Electric Piano 2 [mtyas - FM electric piano](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/4?u=mtyas) 7 Harpsichord 8 Clavinet [tiar - 008-Clavinet](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/44?u=mtyas)
**Chromatic Percussion** 9 Celesta [mtyas - Celesta](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/22?u=mtyas) 10 Glockenspiel [mtyas - Glockenspiel](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/12?u=mtyas) 11 Music Box 12 Vibraphone 13 Marimba 14 Xylophone 15 Tubular Bells 16 Dulcimer
**Organ** 17 Drawbar Organ [mtyas - Drawbar Organ](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/5?u=mtyas) 18 Percussive Organ 19 Rock Organ 20 Church Organ [tiar - ChurchOrgan](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/25?u=mtyas) 21 Reed Organ [mtyas - Street Organ](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/20?u=mtyas) 22 Accordion [mtyas - Accordion](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/24?u=mtyas) 23 Harmonica [tiar - Harmonica](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/27?u=mtyas) 24 Tango Accordion
**Guitar** 25 Acoustic Guitar (nylon) 26 Acoustic Guitar (steel) 27 Electric Guitar (jazz) 28 Electric Guitar (clean) 29 Electric Guitar (muted) 30 Overdriven Guitar 31 Distortion Guitar [tiar - Distortion Guitar](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/32?u=mtyas) 32 Guitar Harmonics
**Bass** 33 Acoustic Bass [mtyas - acoustic bass](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/3?u=mtyas) 34 Electric Bass (finger) 35 Electric Bass (pick) 36 Fretless Bass 37 Slap Bass 1 38 Slap Bass 2 39 Synth Bass 1 [mtyas - Synth Bass 1](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/13?u=mtyas) 40 Synth Bass 2 [tiar - Synth Bass 2] (https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/35?u=mtyas)
**Strings** 41 Violin [mtyas - Violin](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/10?u=mtyas) [tiar - Violin](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/46?u=mtyas) 42 Viola 43 Cello 44 Contrabass 45 Tremolo Strings 46 Pizzicato Strings 47 Orchestral Harp 48 Timpani [mtyas - Timpani](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/19?u=mtyas)
**Ensemble** 49 String Ensemble 1 50 String Ensemble 2 51 Synth Strings 1 52 Synth Strings 2 [tiar - Synth Strings 2](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/26?u=mtyas) 53 Choir Aahs 54 Voice Oohs 55 Synth Choir 56 Orchestra Hit
**Brass** 57 Trumpet 58 Trombone 59 Tuba 60 Muted Trumpet 61 French Horn 62 Brass Section 63 Synth Brass 1 64 Synth Brass 2 [mtyas- Synth Brass](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/6?u=mtyas)
**Reed** 65 Soprano Sax 66 Alto Sax 67 Tenor Sax 68 Baritone Sax 69 Oboe 70 English Horn 71 Bassoon 72 Clarinet
**Pipe** 73 Piccolo 74 Flute [mtyas - Flute](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/21?u=mtyas) 75 Recorder 76 Pan Flute 77 Blown bottle 78 Shakuhachi 79 Whistle 80 Ocarina
**Synth Lead** 81 Lead 1 (square) 82 Lead 2 (sawtooth) 83 Lead 3 (calliope) 84 Lead 4 (chiff) 85 Lead 5 (charang) 86 Lead 6 (voice) 87 Lead 7 (fifths) 88 Lead 8 (bass + lead)
**Synth Pad** 89 Pad 1 (new age) [mtyas - Pad 1](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/18?u=mtyas) 90 Pad 2 (warm[disambiguation needed]) 91 Pad 3 (polysynth) [tiar - Pad 3](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/45?u=mtyas) 92 Pad 4 (choir) 93 Pad 5 (bowed) 94 Pad 6 (metallic) 95 Pad 7 (halo) 96 Pad 8 (sweep)
**Synth Effects** 97 FX 1 (rain) 98 FX 2 (soundtrack) 99 FX 3 (crystal) 100 FX 4 (atmosphere) 101 FX 5 (brightness) 102 FX 6 (goblins) 103 FX 7 (echoes) 104 FX 8 (sci-fi)
**Ethnic** 105 Sitar 106 Banjo 107 Shamisen [mtyas - Shamisen](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/14?u=mtyas) 108 Koto 109 Kalimba 110 Bagpipe 111 Fiddle 112 Shanai
**Percussive** 113 Tinkle Bell 114 Agogo 115 Steel Drums 116 Woodblock 117 Taiko Drum 118 Melodic Tom 119 Synth Drum 120 Reverse Cymbal
**Sound effects** 121 Guitar Fret Noise 122 Breath Noise 123 Seashore 124 Bird Tweet 125 Telephone Ring 126 Helicopter 127 Applause 128 Gunshot
**Drums** [mtyas - SynthDrums](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/general-midi-collaborative-library/2545/11?u=mtyas)
You may find more information about [the GM 1 Sound Set here.](https://www.midi.org/specifications/item/gm-level-1-sound-set)
This job / challenge will probably take a long time, but it could be very rewarding to use the library, and see how others perceive a “given” sound and the ways they use the axo to achieve their goal.

item.title: General Midi collaborative library
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

Library/community/tiar/GM/041-Violin-tiar.axp

A polyphonic violin sound with volume and vibrato controlled by aftertouch (channel or polyphonic).
It uses my new osc tiar/osc/SyncPM3 which has experimental formantic capabilities.

(Loosely based on this Clavia G2 patch)

Read full topic

item.title: General Midi collaborative library
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

Library/community/tiar/GM/091-Pad 3 (polysynth)-tiar.axp
8 voice polyphonic.
Sort of blade runner pad.

Needs to be controlled by a keyboard with aftertouch (channel or polyphonic)
as the filter is totally controlled by pressure.

Read full topic

item.title: General Midi collaborative library
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

Coding these oscs and distortions help me to learn many tricks and gave me new ideas.
I have a few other oscs to experiment with.

About the general phase modulated/distortion wavetable algorithm,
I'm focusing on the integration/differentiation scheme. So, my first attempts use a hardcoded wavetable/distortion.
All my attempts to make a DP2 antialiased phase modulated wavetable osc failed so far (accuracy of division).
Thus, at the moment i'm limited to DP1 antialiasing + x2 oversampling scheme. But well, i think i will stick to it.

Soon I'll have to look at how to use SDCard/SDRAM/SRAM .

Read full topic

item.title: General Midi collaborative library
item.dc:creator: @lokki
item.description:
@lokki wrote:

ok, i see. so you want retriggering of new notes even if you play them legato? and only want to have smooth transition when you release a key and there is still one that is hold? i think for that you will have to write your own (or modify an existing) midi in object.

Read full topic

item.title: General Midi collaborative library
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

I'm not really satisfied with the envelopes when playing "bounce back"

  • In the case of a new note, i want a snappy sound : re-trigger the envelopes.
  • In the case of bouncing back to an old note, i want a smooth sound : no env re-trigering.

I try to figure out how to distinguish those two cases.

Read full topic

item.title: General Midi collaborative library
item.dc:creator: @lokki
item.description:
@lokki wrote:

nice. if you also use the lru midi in object you get the following effect:

when you glide from one note to another and hold the old note it will bounce back to this old note once you release the new note. this is one of the key features in bass synths or in bass synth playing...(at least for me)

Read full topic

item.title: General Midi collaborative library
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

Thanks @lokki for this tip

I did not spotted the glide object in the math directory!

I've used a kfilter to mimic the behaviour of an analog keyboard.
Old analog designs have an analog Sample and Hold circuit that charges a capacitor through a small resistor
See the "Echantillonneur bloqueur / CV" block here:

These basic S&H circuits induce a systematic fast and "clicky" glide.

So I added your legato circuit just before my kfilter:

I like the way it can be controlled It really reminds me my analog synth.

Read full topic

item.title: General Midi collaborative library
item.dc:creator: @lokki
item.description:
@lokki wrote:

great! for typical glide and portamento bass synth stuff i would rather use something like this at the input:

then feed your adsr from gate2 to only retrigger on non-legato notes if you so wish

Read full topic

item.title: General Midi collaborative library
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

Library/community/tiar/GM/031-Distortion-Guitar-tiar.axp
(beware of sound level)

I started this one to test the oversampling / downsampling / antialiasing objects I am developing.

This is a polyphonic patch that uses a common distortion, so the resulting sound mostly depends on the frequency ratios. 4th, 5th and 8ves sound smooth, other ratios will sound harsher.

  • The pitch bend is +- one octave
  • the modulation wheel induces vibrato
  • the aftertouch controls the distortion (gains and cutoff/res of intermediary filter).

The distortion is x2 oversampled. It is based on the classic scheme: sat -> high pass -> sat
The saturations are anti aliased soft clippers (differentiated polynomials and x2 oversampled).

I added a stereotypical ping pong delay.

Read full topic

item.title: General Midi collaborative library
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

Hi @mtyas,

I added +-12 semitone pitch bend to Library/community/tiar/strings/052-Synth-Strings-2-tiar.axp

Pitch bend on chords is evil

Read full topic

item.title: General Midi collaborative library
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

Most of the original string machines used a single HF oscillator and frequency and octave dividers.

Oscillators - in the oscillator banks i coded at the moment - are as easily modulable as any other oscillators.
I already added vibrato inputs for small (multiplicative linear: " * (1+epsilon) " ) frequency deviations (see the Harmonica patch).

I can make up a solution for larger (exponential) modulations and add an input for that.

Read full topic

item.title: General Midi collaborative library
item.dc:creator: @lokki
item.description:

i don't think pitchbend will be easy to add since these patches use a fixed oscillator bank...

I was hoping to easily add pitch bend to them (for my own usage) but I can't see a way my limited brain can do it.
Keep up the great work (I like the saxophone too )

A western movie camp fire by night.

Library/community/tiar/GM/023-Harmonica-tiar.axp

Simply play parallel thirds to get the wild west spirit.

item.title: General Midi collaborative library
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

A Church Organ Patch
Paraphonic with built-in church reverb.

Available in the library:
Library/community/tiar/GM/020-ChurchOrgan-tiar.axp (26.9 KB)

"fb" controls the brilliance.
0 for a dull organ sound.
45 is optimal.

Axoloti is really good at producing FM sounds (good old DX years all over again).
